metadata.Title: CVE-2019-11091 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium
metadata.Description:
Microarchitectural Data Sampling Uncacheable Memory (MDSUM): Uncacheablememory on some microprocessors utilizing speculative execution may allow anauthenticated user to potentially enable information disclosure via a sidechannel with local access. A list of impacted products can be found here:https://www.intel.com/content/dam/www/public/us/en/documents/corporate-information/SA00233-microcode-update-guidance_05132019.pdf

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-11091` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

intel-microcode - 3.20190514.0ubuntu0.16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-211-generic - 4.4.0-148.174
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-211-generic - 4.4.0-148.174
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-211-lowlatency - 4.4.0-148.174
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

No subscription required

criterions.comment: intel-microcode package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.20190514.0ubuntu0.16.04.1').
linux package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-148.174').
linux-goldfish: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-mako: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
